questions.question: One result of the Neolithic Revolution was . . .

choices.answer: an increase in the number of nomadic tribes
a reliance on hunting and gathering for food
the establishment of villages and the rise of government
a decrease in trade among cultural groups.

questions.question: What is the main reason the Neolithic Revolution is considered a turning point in world history?

choices.answer: Fire was used as a source of energy for the first time
Domestication of animals & cultivation of crops led to settled communities
Spoken language was used to improve commication
Stone tools and weapons were first developed

questions.question: Which statement about the Neolithic Revolution is an opinion rather than a fact?

choices.answer: Early people made greater cultural advancements than later civilizations
The Neolithic Revolution resulted in changes for nomadic peoples
New technology was developed during the Neolithic Revolution
Agricultural developments resulted in the establishment of perm. settlement

questions.question: The Code of Hammurabi is an example of . . .

choices.answer: The power of strong kinds to control trade
The power of a legislature to veto laws passed my kings
Regulations on the way to conduct wars against neighboring city-states
Written rules for legal procedures

questions.question: The Code of Hammurabi was major contribution to the development of civilization because it  . . .

choices.answer: Treated citizens and slaves equally
Ended all physical punishment
Record existing laws for all to see
Rejected the principle of innocent before proven guilty

questions.question: Which development led to the other three?

choices.answer: Rise of the Babylon Empire
Hammurabi's Code was developed
Warring States between city-states in Mesopotamia
Babylon is a city-state in Mesopotamia.

questions.question: What is the difference between an empire and a civilization?

choices.answer: Civilizations are independent.  Empires are grouped together under 1 ruler
Civilizations are groups together under 1 ruler. Empires are city-states
Civilizations don't have laws. Empires have a king and few laws
Civilizations have a democracy govt. Empires have a monarch govt.

questions.question: What is the purpose of laws and a government?

choices.answer: Laws and government create equally and safety
Laws and government unify while bringing peace and stability
Laws and governments divided the people in classes
Laws and government provide jobs and a sense of purpose for citizens

questions.question: What are two characteristics of a civilization?

choices.answer: Writing System
Agriculture
Construction of buildings and irrigation system
System of Government

questions.question: Why is Sumer considered a good example of a civilization?

choices.answer: It was a city-state grouped with its neighbors under one central government
It was an independent city-state with its own from of government
It is an empire with its own form of democracy and writing system
It is a city-state run by a neighboring city-state

questions.question: What was the geographic context for the development of the Babylonian Empire?

choices.answer: Babylon was taken over by an neighboring city-state
Babylon was located in the Zagos Mts and was protected by invaders
Babylon was near the Tigris and Euphrates River and had fertile soil
Babylon was near the Mediterranean Sea and developed ports for trade.

questions.question: What was Hammurabi's purpose for writing the Code of Hammurabi?

choices.answer: To provide protection and create social classes
To provide rules, establish order, and to unify the people
To provide a purpose for the people and define jobs
To define his place and create social classes.

questions.question: How did the creation of the Babylon Empire led to the creation of Hammurabi's Code?

choices.answer: The citizens under Hammurabi's rule needed a purpose
Hammurabi needed a grand army to defeat the Romans.
To create a social hierarchy
Hammurabi needed to create a bond between the city-states he conquered
